pageContext.claim: “We must act now to save Americans from the imploding Obamacare disaster.  Premiums have skyrocketed by double-digits and triple-digits in some cases.  As an example, Arizona -- which I talk about all the time -- 116 percent increase and it’s going up a lot higher.  ’17 would be a disaster for Obamacare.  That’s the year it was meant to explode, because Obama won’t be here.  That was when it was supposed to be -- it will get even worse.  As bad as it is now, it’ll get even worse.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cherry-picks data from Arizona, the state hit the hardest by 2017 premium increases under the Affordable Care Act. The average increase for the second-lowest-cost silver plan (which is used as the benchmark to calculate government subsidies) is 25 percent. A few states, such as Indiana, actually saw a decrease.
